page.title: 10THE BROOK,FARNBOROUGH.
page.content: The brook is a small stream that flows gently through northern Farnborough.Its{source}is in three places,{Hawley Lake,Pyestock marsh} ,and in the marsh area around the new{ {Southwood Golf Course}.It flows north until it reaches the {River {Blackwater},then it flows into the River Wey,and finally it flows into the{River Thames}. There are a great number of small creatures living in the brook,our class collected {22}different species.Most of them live in the weeds that clog up the stream in the summer months,the council often have to dredge out the brook so as to stop the stream flooding during the wet season.The creatures that live here are,dragonflies,stoneflies,newt,loach, snails,leeches,frogs,beetles,daphnia, shrimps,sticklebacks,pond skaters etc.
